title: screen locked on iPhone 7+ Asking to press button OK
content:
on my iPhone 7+ the firefox screen is locked. message says: https://networkdefense-guardian.com Your device is infected and vulnerable to cyber-attacks and data theft! To protect your iPhone press the button below. there are two buttons: CONFIRM is not active OK in colour blue, I assume is active. I have not pressed the button.

How do I prevent this hack, assuming it is a hacker? How do I unlock screen safely so can use firefox?
creator: king7hlg

title: recently closed tab show the tabs of all opened windows at once instead only one.
content: I don't know if it is because i closed firefox task end, or if it is a bug from update to v119 (when i reopened firefox, there was the updated tab). But now when i fly my pointer on "recently closed tab", instead of only having the 15 last closed tab of my current firefox windows, i have also the 15 of each opened firefox windows. means if i have 2 page it show 30 tabs, etc. the first 15 being the tab of the current windows (ex: FF windows 1) and the 15 next for the other opened one (FF windows 2), when i check "recently closed tab" on the other windows it is reversed (the 15 first tab are the windows 2 closed ones, and the 15 next from the windows 1). It is me, or a global bug (or new feature). If the second, how to return to the former option (means having only the tab closed from the current windows showing)
creator: thor94

title: Weird text in firefox fixes itself when firefox is turned off
content: Firefox displays weird characters in text when some pages are loaded. This appears to happen with Helvetica font and maybe some others. The problem seems to go away when firefox is launched in safe mode, and does not occur in other browsers. After a little digging I found when I turn hardware acceleration off the problem seems to fix itself. I'd rather not operate firefox with this option off, and I have a relatively new mac so this shouldn't be an issue. Is there a better way to solve this problem? Attached are pictures of the issue when hardware acceleration is on. As you can see, there are weird characters that display on the right.
creator: bradenbouwman

title: Sketchy request to update Firefox
content: A webpage (https://cozumelparks.com/en/chankanaab/) occasionally tells me I need to update Firefox. (FYI, something similar happens when I access the page via Chrome). I've checked and know my Firefox is up-to-date. So, this seems very sketchy. What's up with this seemingly dangerous request to click and "Update Firefox"??
creator: ffox23
